text: 14.114 In all circumstances, designing for inclusiveness means designing with the community, and ensuring the community feel that they have been able to co-design development, rather than having development imposed upon them. The gender-inclusive design evidence base shows that when women and girls are closely consulted, their lived experiences are listened to, and their needs inform design outcomes, this helps to create places with high social and economic prosperity and to build stronger social networks and climate resilience - that is, it BACK TO POLICIES
